intro: Mediocalcar versteegii subsp. amphigeneum, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, herbaceous appearance. The subspecies amphigeneum is distinguished by its specific morphological features, including the structure of its flowers and leaves.
